docs.snippet: SWAN.--In this City, on Monday, Aug. 23, ANN COLVILL relict of Charles Swan. The friends of the family. and those of her brother. Alfred Colvill are respectfully invited to attend her funeral from her late residence. No. 68 West 32d-st. on Thursday...
docs.lead_paragraph: SWAN.--In this City, on Monday, Aug. 23, ANN COLVILL relict of Charles Swan. The friends of the family. and those of her brother. Alfred Colvill are respectfully invited to attend her funeral from her late residence. No. 68 West 32d-st. on Thursday afternoon. at 3 o'clock without further invitation.

docs.snippet: The steamship Hermann, Capt. CAVENDY, left her pier foot of North Moore-street, yesterday at 6 o'clock, P M, amidst the firing of cannon and the cheers of the multitude who had assembled to see her off Her decks were crowded with California and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Hermann, Capt. CAVENDY, left her pier foot of North Moore-street, yesterday at 6 o'clock, P M, amidst the firing of cannon and the cheers of the multitude who had assembled to see her off Her decks were crowded with California and Fraser River bound passengers. She anchored opposite Bedloe's Island and will go to sea by this morning's tide.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: Your candor, in admitting to your columns remarks from those that differ from you, has induced this communication. In general I agree with you and relish your comments, on public and social matters.
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: Your candor, in admitting to your columns remarks from those that differ from you, has induced this communication. In general I agree with you and relish your comments, on public and social matters.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; THE OCEAN TELEGRAPH.

docs.snippet: The Commissioners met on Monday. Dr. THOMPSON reported on the case of the bark C.O. Fewler. The report was accepted and its recommendation adopted. A communication was received from Dr, WATSON Assistant Physician at the Marine Hospital, in reference...

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Health Commissioners. Police Intelligence. Fires. A Moonment to Crawford. Mayor's Office.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Commissioners met on Monday. Dr. THOMPSON reported on the case of the bark C.O. Fewler. The report was accepted and its recommendation adopted. A communication was received from Dr, WATSON Assistant Physician at the Marine Hospital, in reference to cases of fever reported to have existed on Staten Island.

docs.snippet: A dispatch received yesterday announced the death of JAMES EDDY, Esq., a gentleman who has been the General Superintendent of the American Telegraph Company since its formation some three years ago. Mr. EDDY died of the heart disease yesterday...
docs.lead_paragraph: A dispatch received yesterday announced the death of JAMES EDDY, Esq., a gentleman who has been the General Superintendent of the American Telegraph Company since its formation some three years ago. Mr. EDDY died of the heart disease yesterday morning. at the American House, in Burlington, Vt.

docs.snippet: Monday, Aug. 23, 1858. To the Editor of the New-York Times: DEAR SIR: I beg to hand you the accompanying copy of a dispatch from St. Johns, N. F. Yours, E. CUNARD Per THOS. M. NIMMO. "ST. JOHNS, N. F., Aug. 23.--E. CUNARD: The Persia appeared off...

headline.main: SEA AND SHIP NEWS.; The Persta at St. Johas, N. F.

docs.lead_paragraph: Monday, Aug. 23, 1858. To the Editor of the New-York Times: DEAR SIR: I beg to hand you the accompanying copy of a dispatch from St. Johns, N. F. Yours, E. CUNARD Per THOS. M. NIMMO. "ST. JOHNS, N. F., Aug. 23.--E. CUNARD: The Persia appeared off here at 1036 A. M., received the passengers and mails of the steamship Eurpoa, and proceeded at 11 o'clock."

docs.snippet: The second annual meeting of the Old Settler of Indiana was held at Kingstown Springs, on the 12th of August. Large numbers were present, many of the pioneers bringing baskets for a plc-nic dinner In the grove. Among the veterans who conquered the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The second annual meeting of the Old Settler of Indiana was held at Kingstown Springs, on the 12th of August. Large numbers were present, many of the pioneers bringing baskets for a plc-nic dinner In the grove. Among the veterans who conquered the Western forests and Indians, was the patriarch JACOH PARKHURST.

headline.main: SEA AND SHIP NEWS.; Departure of the Hermann for California.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Hermann is announced to sail for California and Fraser River direct, from Pier No. 36 North River, at 4 o'clock P. M., to-day. Her detention was unavoidable. on account of unfinished carpenter's work in making the alterations which have been necessary in fitting her for the present voyage.
